documents.title: HelloTech FAQ: HelloTech employee hub in Poland
documents.content: ÔªøHelloTech FAQ: HelloTech employee hub in Poland Employee Experience How will this change impact me, my role, and my responsibilities? Only roles created through natural attrition within our organization will be centralized in Poland. Adding another hub will not affect your current roles or responsibilities as we already work across multiple hubs with team members in different locations. Given the Hybrid working policy for SE employees and others, how should we navigate the implications of having a more physically distributed team? The decision to open a new hub in Poland doesn‚Äôt change our stance on hybrid work‚Äîemployees in Poland will follow the same 3-day in-office hybrid practices as other sites. As we do today, some employees or leaders may be required to travel between locations hosting hybrid team-building activities, and others to ensure everyone feels part of the team, regardless of their contractual workplace. What factors are considered when choosing where to hire? We expect to leverage natural attrition to jump-start our Poland site. The quality of talent in Poland allows us to maintain our development capacity and support critical business needs in a cost effective manner. As we have shared in other communications, we have ambitious plans for reducing Cost to Serve. Our Poland site allows us to backfill roles and enables us to deliver our Key Strategies. Berlin will continue to be the HQ of HelloTech and we will continue backfilling roles in other Tech hubs based on business needs, talent availability, and cost considerations. Company Strategy What are the key business drivers for this strategic move? Opening a presence in Wroc≈Çaw is a key step in our strategy to improve efficiency, achieve sustainable success, and better meet our business goals while enhancing our capabilities. This step also helps us to support our financial goals by backfilling roles in locations like Poland, where lower costs allow us to operate more efficiently. We are focused on achieving significant cost savings over the next few years, so we can invest more in our product. The new hub in Wroc≈Çaw will not only help us meet these financial objectives but also provide access to a strong talent pool, with key skillsets, and complement our existing hubs. How will the establishment of the Wroc≈Çaw hub support our long-term business strategy beyond Tech. Have other locations been reviewed? When evaluating opportunities, we do a comprehensive review, considering factors like location stability, talent availability, cost efficiency, growth potential, and scalability. Wroc≈Çaw checks all these boxes, making it an excellent choice for long-term expansion. Line Management As a line manager, what can I expect from this change, and what is expected of me? As a leader at HelloFresh, your role in driving this change is critical. Focus on building a collaborative, unified culture that works efficiently and delivers strong results. Clear and effective communication is vital, especially across sites. Ensure your team understands the context, reasoning, and how their work contributes to HelloFresh's overall success. Uphold the HelloFresh Group values, foster a positive work environment, and respect corporate policies as well as local nuances. Lastly, when it comes to recruitment, please note that the steps of the hiring process will be BAU, however, now including Poland. If you currently have open roles or questions about recruitment in Poland, please reach out to Juliana de Carvalho Nogueira and work with your Alliance leader to determine the logistical next steps. ============================================================ ## EMAIL CONTENTS ============================================================ ---------------------------------------- ### EMAIL: Re: Homepage not shown for HelloFresh iOS App ID: 19b2704fc7d4d494 From: Elena Pavlova ---------------------------------------- Hi team, The issue is being investigated in https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C0A3ESS0SEB Thanks, Elena > On Dec 16, 2025, at 6:51‚ÄØAM, Gabriel Range wrote: > > I am on the latest AppStore version of the Hellofresh iOS App. When opening the App the Home Screen shows empty. > > > > > Gabriel Range > Customer Order Management and Shopping Experience Tribe Lead | Director Engineering > HelloFresh SE | Prinzenstra√üe 89 | 10969 Berlin, Germany > Email: gabriel.range@hellofresh.com > > > > HelloFresh SE, Berlin (Sitz der Gesellschaft) | Vorst√§nde: Dominik S. Richter (Vorsitzender), Thomas W. Griesel, Fabien Simon, Edward Boyes | Vorsitzender des Aufsichtsrats: John H. Rittenhouse | Eingetragen beim Amtsgericht Charlottenburg, HRB 182382 B | USt-Id Nr.: DE 302210417 > > CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This message (including any attachments) is confidential and may be privileged. It may be read, copied and used only by the intended recipient. If you have received it in error please contact the sender (by return e-mail) immediately and delete this message. Any unauthorized use or dissemination of this message in whole or in parts is strictly prohibited. > > -- > You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "HelloTech" group. > To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to hellotech+unsubscribe@hellofresh.com . > To view this discussion visit https://groups.google.com/a/hellofresh.com/d/msgid/hellotech/CAE13YoNfTzSiiB877YiAq3KxMz3S080BZpUxpQdZ3X%2BXD9zqOw%40mail.gmail.com . ---------------------------------------- ### EMAIL: Homepage not shown for HelloFresh iOS App ID: 19b2700e90b0694c From: Gabriel Range ---------------------------------------- [No readable text content found] ---------------------------------------- ### EMAIL: Task deleted: HelloFresh Homepage Order cards experiment_16.12.25 ID: 19b26e73a559d351 From: "'Lokalise' via New Ventures All" ---------------------------------------- Lokalise

documents.title: Alexander Matlin - Handover - Vacation Coverage (31.12.2025 - 11.01.2026)
documents.content:
ÔªøAlexander Matlin - Handover - Vacation Coverage (31.12.2025 - 11.01.2026)

This document provides an overview of ongoing projects and their current status for seamless handover during my vacation period from Dec 31, 2025 to Jan 11, 2026. Please refer to this document for all necessary information regarding project progress, key contacts, and pending actions.









Topic

	Description

	Assignee

	Status

	Charge at Checkout

	The experiment allocation was stopped on Dec 29, 2025because of two issues:

* [Experimentation Core] Statsig Group Assignment health issue (thread)

   * Experimentation Core team will be able to start investigation on Jan 7, 2025 when the only developer comes back from vacations.

* [Payments] Spike in 500 errors for C@C flow (thread)

   * 8% error rate for C@C flow

	Beatrice Dimarucut to escalate to Daniel AriasNikita Gorshkov if needed

	To Do

	OTP

	After changing the approach to use OTP API endpoint instead of the reactivation flow, we need to update the existing tickets to reflect the new approach (specifically the Graduation Component)

	Beatrice Dimarucut to ask Himash Tehan to update the rest of the OTP tickets

	To Do

	Good Chop Hiring

	Three new positions have been created and they are waiting for approval from Holger Hammel

* P378007 Senior Frontend Engineer

   * Jaussman Sanchez (internal candidate)

* P378008 Frontend Engineer

   * Vinh Nguyen (internal candidate)

* P378009 Senior Backend Engineer

   * Liubov Fomicheva (internal candidate)

   * Vinicius Fernandes de Jesus will facilitate technical interview





	Daniel Arias to get approval from Holger Hammel and officially open the position

	To Do

	New York Expenses Approval

	  



	Daniel Arias to approve

	To Do

documents.title: LEGO: Unified Prospects Checkout Features and Layout for Meal Brands
documents.content:
ÔªøLEGO: Unified Prospects Checkout Features and Layout for Meal Brands





1. Goal





Our goal is to create a single, unified prospects checkout layout with standardized features that will work centrally for all Mealkit brands (HelloFresh, GreenChef, EveryPlate, and ChefsPlate) and RTE brands (Factor and Youfoodz).[a][b][c][d][e]





Checkout is a critical phase in the acquisition funnel where users register or log in, provide their address, select delivery options, and add payment details.

Unified feature is a shared component that can operate across multiple countries, brands, and user journeys. Once implemented, any new functionality built on this Feature is automatically available wherever the feature is deployed, ensuring consistency across the board. Features list are available on the portal: https://www-staging.hellofresh.com/features?f=DeliverySummaryFeature

Modular checkout is the checkout code setup, which consists of  independent, reusable unified Features.

Checkout layout is a structure for how elements are interconnected as part of it.





RTE - Ready-to-Eat Brands (Factor, Youufoodz)

WLMK/New Mealkits - Mealkit brands (GreenChef, EveryPlate, and ChefsPlate)









2. Problem Statement





The HelloFresh Group has expanded to 8 brands across 18 countries, which requires scalable solutions to avoid isolated work efforts. The prospects checkout process to purchase subscription can be identical across all brands and products, which makes it the first user experience that can be standardized and managed centrally.





In January 2025, the activation user journey scope was transferred from TAM Alliance to Growth Alliance to centralize Checkout ownership within one team. Two brands, GoodChop and Pets Table, remain in TAM. Scope now increased to 31 distinct codes to manage (18 in HelloFresh with 6 in New Mealkits and 7 in RTE added on top). To scale further and grow sustainably, a strong foundation is needed. HelloFresh has set an 2025 objective #1 to accelerate product development velocity for Ready-to-eat (RTE) brands by distributing ownership of core customer journeys across the consumer-facing-alliances (CFAs).





The Reduce Effort Needed to Checkout strategy initiated in 2024 involved refactoring the HelloFresh checkout into a modular checkout with unified features. By the end of 2024, the scope expanded to include RTE and WLML, aiming to unify features across all meal brands. More details are in Modular Checkout. The goal for H1-2025 is to complete feature modularization and unify the layouts for all meal brands. The new checkout layout will use the technical format that was created during the Single Page Checkout initiative. More details in Single Page Checkout: Experiment Results.  





Quick Status Overview (more details are in APPENDIX A [ROADMAP])





Checkout Features Rollout Statuses:





Feature

	HF

	RTE (Factor & Youfoodz) & WLMK (GreenChef, EveryPlate, and ChefsPlate)

	Order Summary Feature

	‚úÖRolled out

	‚úÖRolled out

	Register Form Feature

	üü£Experiment Re-Launch

	‚úÖRolled out

	Social Logins Feature

	üü£Experiment Re-Launch

	‚ö™Ô∏è Neutral Results, No Rollout

	Address Form Feature

	‚úÖRolled out

	‚úÖRolled out

	Delivery Details Feature

	‚úÖRolled out Mobile

	‚úÖRolled out Mobile: Neutral Results

	Payment Methods

	‚úÖRolled out

	‚úÖRolled out Factor US

	Unified Layout - Lego Checkout

	‚úÖRolled out





	‚úÖRolled out

	







3. Impact of Modular Checkout Features and Shared Layout

This initiative modularizes HelloFresh, RTE, and New Mealkits (GreenChef, Chefs Plate, Every Plate) Checkouts with Fe



 UFI-9680: Integrate with New Progress bar

Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025

	Remove invalid voucher from payload after first checkout attempt 

	Use Control Logic

	      * Remove Invalid voucher before making OPS call/query params UFI-9678 Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025

	Redirect to plans page or register if not logged in or no plan selected 

	Use Control Logic

	      * Add check for logged-in user/cart-id and redirect UFI-9682: Add check for logged-in user/cart-id and redirect Completed ETA Mar 28, 2025

	



	



	      * UFI-9686: Add lego-checkout applanga group for caching Completed

      * UFI-9693: Check requirement for CTA sticky-ness Not Started

	







































































































[a]NV not mentioned, despite accounting for ¬±$250M in annual revenue in 2025, planned $300M+ in 2026

[b]Original scope did not include NV, focusing on mealkits and RTE brands unification

[c]@nikita.gorshkov@hellofresh.com how would this work for NV? You have completely different features in your conversion funnels and the reuse of the same components across all brands is part of this initiative

[d]So, looking at the checkout features below, the majority of them are the same. While we have some additional features such as welcome kits and trial boxes, I think those can be built as additional components within Lego, no?

[e]Of course they can be built but would need to be ready for us to launch lego as well as all differences in areas like Logistics and Fraud, for example. We've been testing for 6 months across HF and Factor and are still adding/fixing things because of all the custom logic, so this will not be an easy addition. But we can definitely assist your team in adopting Lego

[f]@anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com let's add the ticket in the Epic for the items which will need to be moved to Features still.

_Assigned to anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com_

[g]@anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com for our layout work we would need to build this one in too right? Did you consider it in the broken down tickets?

_Assigned to anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com_

[h]@harneet.singh@hellofresh.com what is the status here?

_Assigned to harneet.singh@hellofresh.com_

[i]US experiment is currently live. Rollout decision to be made mid-March

[j]@anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com to add a spike

_Assigned to anupam.maurya@hellofresh.com_

documents.title: IXI Results: Creator Marketplace Customer Interviews
documents.content:
ÔªøResearch Results

Executive Summary: 

Research participants responded very positively to the Influencer Marketplace concept, viewing it as a compelling way to turn social media food inspiration into achievable home cooking. The concept resonates because it directly addresses two major friction points: difficulty sourcing niche ingredients, due to cost, waste, and effort, and the common habit of saving recipes that are later forgotten in overcrowded digital collections.

Trust in recipes is driven less by influencer status[a][b] and more by practical signals of feasibility, including strong visuals, clear instructions, and access to the original social media content for verification. Participants place significant responsibility on HelloFresh to ensure recipe quality, either through internal testing and approval or, if full vetting is not feasible, through transparent and prominent community ratings and reviews.

The marketplace is perceived primarily as an occasion-based solution rather than a replacement for everyday meal planning. Participants most strongly associate it with dinner and special occasions such as weekends or hosting, with limited interest in breakfast or lunch use cases. To encourage trial and adoption, users strongly prefer a low-commitment purchasing model, favoring one-time purchases over subscription requirements.[c][d]

Discovery expectations are food-first rather than creator-led, with users wanting to browse and search by ingredient or cuisine instead of influencer names. Finally, participants expressed a need for more robust recipe management tools, including custom organization and scheduling features, to ensure saved recipes resurface at the right time and translate into actual cooking behavior.

Recommendations:

Topic

	Concern

	Recommendation

	Building Creator Trust

	In this marketplace, users may find it challenging to evaluate creators in the same ways they do on social media. 

	* Direct Links to Original Videos: To foster greater trust in creators, half of participants (4 out of 8) suggested the inclusion of direct links on recipe pages. These links should lead back to the influencer's original social media video, providing direct visual instruction and making it simpler for users to verify and find their content.

	Recipe Vetting

	Participants generally expressed skepticism about recipe reliability from unverified creators, with the majority expecting HelloFresh to act as a "safety net" by vetting recipes for safety and feasibility. Without HelloFresh vetting all recipes, users need to be able to have the information to evaluate the recipes themselves.

	* Verified Badge: If HelloFresh chooses to quality test any of the recipes, a visual distinction like a tag or a badge should indicate which recipes have been tested by HelloFresh chefs, in contrast to unverified user-uploaded content.

* Unfiltered Reviews: Users desire a transparent review system that includes recipe ratings, customer feedback, and photos. This system should allow users to view any negative feedback or potential issues, helping them determine the trustworthiness of a recipe creator. 

* Recipe Comments or Q&A: Participants indicated a need for a comment or Q&A section, separate from a typical review system. This feature would allow them to see and address challenges or questions raised by other users before they begin cooking, increasing their confidence in the recipe's quality and preparedness.





	Purchase Models

	Participants viewed a forced subscription as a financial and psychological barrier to trying influencer reci



the actual value the marketplace provides to the user? If its not the influencers, why are we not just going for a OTP in HF instead?

[d]I would argue that while random creators they don't know aren't the main driver that excites them, the variety, creativity, and uniqueness of creator made recipes is the exciting part for them. Additionally, the creators they do know, follow, and trust are the ones that excite them the most to purchase recipes from. 





I think if we just did OTP and removed the creator element completely, we would definitely be missing the drivers that make this concept interesting.

[e]Clip about sentiment/reactions to the concept

[f]this is an argument toward my previous comment, but this would be the perfect result, to find every recipe online in hf marketplace as a purchasable option

[m]Clip: What saved recipes should look like
